item.title: Vector-borne disease
item.description: Vectorborne diseases are diseases that are transmitted from an arthropod (usually a tick or mosquito, etc.) to humans or other animals. Some vectorborne disease agents are maintained primarily through transmission between arthropods and humans (e.g., dengue virus and malaria), while others are maintained between arthropods and animal reservoirs (e.g., Lyme disease and West Nile virus) and humans may become infected incidentally. Vectorborne Disease and the Environment Climate is one of many important interacting variables that affect peopleâ€™s risk for vectorborne diseases in New York City.
